description: Patrick Crusius, 24, agreed to plead guilty to federal charges after prosecutors said they would not seek the death penalty. But he still faces a state trial in which he could be sentenced to death.
title: Man Pleads Guilty to Hate Crimes in El Paso Walmart Mass Shooting
title_page: Man Pleads Guilty to Hate Crimes in El Paso Walmart Mass Shooting - The New York Times
maintext:
A Texas man who fatally shot 23 people and injured dozens more at a Walmart store in El Paso in 2019 pleaded guilty on Wednesday to federal hate crimes and weapons charges in connection with the deadliest anti-Latino attack in modern United States history.
Lawyers for the gunman, Patrick Crusius, said last month that he would change his plea to guilty days after federal prosecutors notified the court that they would not seek the death penalty. He has agreed to accept a sentence of 90 consecutive life terms, according to the U.S. Attorneyâ€™s Office for the Western District of Texas. Mr. Crusius is to be formally sentenced in June.
Mr. Crusius, 24, still faces trial on state capital murder charges, for which he could receive the death penalty.
He appeared in U.S. District Court in El Paso on Wednesday afternoon, where he pleaded guilty to all 90 federal charges that he faced, including 45 hate crimes.
